group_1.textRight: What's with this magic reaction...?!
This reaction feels...
Is that...true...?
So what you said at the time wasn't a lie, and@the two of them really became Witches...?

group_1.textLeft: We didn't know either.

group_1.textRight: We learned the truth the very same day we sent@you home, Urara-dono.

group_1.textLeft: So, once again, don't become a Magical Girl.
Because no matter how much trouble you're in,@or how strong your desire is,
there's a harsh fate awaiting you if you take@Kyubey's word for it...

group_1.textRight: I get it, y'know...
But, it's cruel...

group_1.textLeft: Even if you condemn us, we cannot complain...
Ultimately, we Magical Girls end up becoming@the ones who spread curses.

group_1.textRight: No, that's not what I meant...!
I just don't think such a fate is worth the price...!

group_1.textLeft: Urara-dono...
That's why, I thought I'd at least let you@know about us.
The three of us are going to take action to@inform the world.
Even if it all won't be resolved, we still hope for@some words of comfort...

group_1.textRight: Now that you've saved my life, I can't just stand@by and watch.
Right, I wanna do something to help.

group_1.textLeft: You already did, you know?

group_1.textRight: How could that be?

group_1.textLeft: In order to meet us, you introduced Magical Girls@on your show.
Thanks to that, word is starting to catch on among@the students.

group_1.textRight: Ah...

group_1.textLeft: The very power of the media.@I'm rather grateful to you.

group_1.textRight: In fact, Urara-dono, I rescued someone yesterday@who had seen your show...
Having been his friend, I confessed to him@that I was a Magical Girl.

group_1.textLeft: How did it go...?

group_1.textRight: He accepted me, and in a favorable way, too.

group_1.textLeft: The effective way you put the power of your@show to good use is on display, Urara-chan.

group_1.textRight: Even I'm surprised that I helped you out like@that, you know!

group_1.textLeft: *Giggle*♪

group_1.narration: "Actually,@there's been a change among Magical Girls,@and from the messages in the group chat,@it seems that more and more girls are thinking@about telling someone about their identity."
"The truth about Witches is something that many@Magical Girls are unaware of, and it's a delicate@and sensitive topic, so it doesn't really come up@in our conversations."
"Still, we try to tell the people we trust@about Magical Girls and Witches."

group_1.textRight: Hey, maybe there's an opportunity for you!

group_1.textLeft: An opportunity?

group_1.textRight: I mean, an opportunity to tell the whole of@Yukuni City about you guys.

group_1.textLeft: Tell us more about it.

group_1.textRight: At the Festival, I'm gonna be performing on stage.
But we've also secured a program slot for an@on-site Nightlife Homeroom.
And I can introduce you three as guests while@bringing up the topic of Magical Girls.
Kurara might get mad at me, but...
To elevate Magical Girls from the status of@urban legends,
this could be a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity!

group_1.textLeft: Sounds pretty risky, but...

group_1.textRight: When you say it's a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity,@it's certainly true.
Just, it can't take too long.
I think we better narrow down what we tell@and show as much as we can.

group_1.textLeft: Agreed. It’s because of our valuable preexisting@relationships
that Miura and I have already been accepted as@Magical Girls in the first place.
We need to go through the steps properly, or else@we'll just end up confusing people.

group_1.textRight: That's true.
Alright, so regarding that whole idea about@everyone joining in at the Festival...

group_1.textLeft: Let's proceed with your plan.

group_1.textRight: Certainly, that's advisable.

group_1.textLeft: Mhm.
